problems.title: Wilson's Theorem Check
problems.description:
Wilson's Theorem states that a natural number p > 1 is a prime number if and only if (p-1)! ≡ -1 (mod p).

You are given a positive integer N. Your task is to check whether N is prime using Wilson's Theorem.

Input Format:
A single integer N.

Output Format:
Print "YES" if N is prime, otherwise print "NO".
problems.examples:
Sample Input
5

Sample Output
YES

Explanation:
(5-1)! = 24, 24 % 5 = 4 ≡ -1 mod 5, so 5 is prime.
hintsList: Compute (n-1)! % n. If it's n-1, then n is prime. But only use for small n due to factorial size.
